title: Venica & Venica 2014 Jesera Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Showing copper reflections, this vibrant wine offers enticing scents of white wildflower and orchard fruit. The savory palate presents poached Bartlett pear, nectarine zest and a mineral note accompanied by firm acidity.

title: Trullo 2014 Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Nimble and spry, this off-dry Riesling boasts crisp cantaloupe and white peach flavors accented by blossomy perfume. A delicately sweet-tart quaffer, it finishes with a deliciously astringent touch of tea tannins. Drink now through 2018.

title: Von Schleinitz 2014 Riesling (Mosel)
description: While the nose is quite neutral, the palate of this off-dry Riesling boasts ripe, concentrated peach and apricot flavors bolstered by sunny lemon acidity. Juicy and mouthwatering, it's a lively sip to be enjoyed young.

title: Weinreich 2014 Basisrot Red (Rheinhessen)
description: Blossomy floral and bramble notes accent ripe black currant and raspberry flavors in this zesty blend of Dornfelder, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. It's plush and velvety in mouthfeel and maintains intensity through a moderately long finish. Drink now through 2018.

title: Klaus Lentsch 2014 Amperg Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: Subdued aromas suggesting yellow apple and a touch of citrus emerge after a few twirls of the glass. On the tangy palate, a vein of mineral and crisp acidity underscore juicy tastes of nectarine, pear and a hint of crystalized ginger.

title: Kornell 2014 Cosmas Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: Cut grass, tomato vine and gooseberry aromas lead the way on this zesty white. Racy acidity underscores grapefruit, kiwi and a hint of green bell pepper while a mineral note invigorates the finish.

title: Elena Walch 2014 Castel Ringberg Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: This has a rather shy nose that reluctantly reveals hay, fennel, white flower and a whiff of exotic fruit. The bright, linear palate shows grapefruit, unripened yellow peach, vanilla and a mineral note accompanied by tangy acidity.

title: EOS 2013 Tears of Dew Muscat Canelli (Paso Robles)
description: Quite a crowd-pleasing dessert wine, this shows orange blossoms, tonic and honey on the complex nose. The palate is pleasantly measured in flavors, with tangerine and honeyed butter flavors that play on a soft texture between the sweetness and tang, all presented with lively acidity.

title: Fairsing 2013 Dardis Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: The Dardis designate is a mix of Wädenswil and Dijon 115 clones, aged in 30% new French oak. This is light and tangy, showing detailed flavors of just-ripe berries framed in citrus-peel phenolics. The oak is hiding at the moment, but the acids are in full view.

title: Gnarly Head 2014 Chardonnay (California)
description: Full body and a good depth of flavor add up to a wine that's well suited for almost any occasion. Pear and ripe apple aromas lead to flavors of light toast, butter, nutmeg and vanilla, alongside a solid, well-balanced structure.

title: Zuani 2013 Riserva White (Collio)
description: Made with a blend of Friulano, Chardonnay, Sauvignon and Pinot Grigio, this opens with aromas of toasted oak and vanilla. The lean palate offers yellow apple skin, pineapple and mineral alongside brisk acidity.

title: Scott Paul 2014 La Paulée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Production has more than doubled, which may account for a dilution in quality from past vintages. Lightly spicy, with a streak of pepper and cinnamon, this is a pleasant wine, but thins out quickly.

title: WillaKenzie Estate 2013 Emery Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Light and subtle, this offers tart cherry fruit with hints of mushroom. The texture and definition somewhat compensate for the overall lightness and lack of depth. It's a graceful, elegant wine best enjoyed young.

title: Caldaro 2014 Sauvignon (Alto Adige)
description: Varietal scents of cut grass, grapefruit and a hint of tomato vine come forward on this vibrant white. The racy palate offers gooseberry, kiwi and a note of green bell pepper that lead up to a tangy finish.

title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Somontes Colheita Red (Dão)
description: This is a fruity, juicy wine that has a dry tanninc core. That gives a mineral texture to the otherwise ripe and fruity wine. Full of black currant fruit flavors, shot through with acidity, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Château Barreyres 2015 Barrel Sample  (Haut-Médoc)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. A smoky, smoothly textured wine, this has a light texture that suggests it will develop quickly. There is plenty of red fruit and attractive acidity.

title: Chateau Grand Traverse 2012 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: With 26 months in small oak barrels, aromas of coconut cream, finely ground sawdust and cherry stems ride over condensed black cherry and currant. The medium-weight palate has a plush feel to it, offering a balance of ripe berry fruit and zesty streaks of minerals.

title: Abbazia di Novacella 2014 Müller-Thurgau (Alto Adige Valle Isarco)
description: Delicate scents of elderflower and orchard fruit mix in the glass while the lively palate offers rennet apple, citrus zest and a whiff of nutmeg. Crisp acidity brightens the juicy flavors.

title: Apriori 2014 Hicks Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Cola, black cherry and crushed purple flowers show on the nose of this bottling, one of the first reds to emerge from the 2014 vintage. It's light and energetic on the palate, with tangy cranberry juice and a touch of licorice.

title: August Truth 2013 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light and clear in color, this wine veers into cool-climate, restrained territory in its well-defined lines of sage, dried herb and stemmy earth. Dry tannins give an oomph of power beneath traces of dried rose.

title: Bernat 2014 Rosé of Nebbiolo (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: An uncommon source grape for pink wine, this Nebbiolo shows lemon juice and watermelon on the rather rich and inviting nose. The palate's grippy texture packs flavors of strawberry fruit and lime zest, with acidic energy that would make a perfect pairing for fried chicken or heartier fish.

title: Bodega Norton 2013 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: This screaming violet-colored chunkster is big and blocky up front, with aromas of vitamins and grapy black fruits. A giant palate holds big tannins, while heady flavors of black plum and oak spice finish minty, toasty and with power.

title: Bouchaine 2013 Bacchus Collection Estate Vineyard Pinot Meunier (Carneros)
description: Rare to find on its own, as it's mainly used in sparkling-wine blends, this Pinot Meunier is earthy in dark truffle and herb, more savory, dry flavors that are wrapped in tightly woven tannins and oak. The muted fruit that's there recalls sweet raspberry.

title: Brys 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Old Mission Peninsula)
description: Dark-berry aromas meet hints of menthol and game on the nose. The medium-bodied palate follows suit on entry, but becomes lighter by the midpalate from a slick of minerality. Pair alongside gamy meats such as grilled venison loin.

title: Bulas 2011 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: This LBV from the Bulas family vineyards, downriver from Pinhão is all ready to drink. It is fruity with just the right amount of structure. Fresh berry fruits are lifted by fine acidity and well integrated into the smooth, just tannic structure. Drink now.

title: C. von Nell-Breuning 2014 Kaseler Dominikaner Riesling (Mosel)
description: Flavors of pressed apple and pears are uncomplicated but pleasing in this sprightly off-dry Riesling. While delicately framed, it's punchy and penetrating, finishing with a lingering apple-cider sweetness. Drink now through 2017.

title: Château Paveil de Luze 2015 Barrel Sample  (Margaux)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. This is a tannin-driven wine, firm and with hints of bitter extraction. It does have the black fruit to compensate and potentially balance it out.

title: Château Pitray 2015 Barrel Sample  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Red fruits dominate this wine, while light tannins, a smoky undertone and a clear line of acidity make it bright. There's a subtle mineral edge, while the finish is fresh and fruity.

title: Colterenzio 2014 Puiten Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Aromas of orchard fruit, nut and a light whiff of toast lift from the glass. The medium-bodied, straightforward palate offers pear, apple and a note of lemon drop. Vibrant acidity gives it a clean finish.

title: Delaire Graff 2012 Chenin Blanc (Swartland)
description: An underlying richness and toasty character grounds the upfront aromas of citrus pith, green apple and pineapple core. Accessible and friendly, the structure is soft and easy, with medium acidity and light flavors of ripe pear flesh, honeydew and creamed orange. A hint of peach-pit nuttiness graces the medium-length finish. Drink now.
